title: Neural Programmer-Interpreters Learn To Write Programs
description: In machine learning, we usually have a set of problems for which we are looking for solutions. For instance, "here is an image, please tell me what is seen on it". Or, "here is a computer game, please beat level three". One problem, one solution. In this case, we are not looking for one solution, we are looking for a computer program, an algorithm, that can solve any number of problems of the same kind. It can also learn how to rotate images of different cars around to obtain a frontal pose. This technique can learn from someone how to sort a set of 20 numbers and generalize its knowledge to much longer sequences. The paper "Neural Programmer-Interpreters" is available here: http://www-personal.umich.edu/~reedscot/iclr project.html The thumbnail image was created by Iwan Gabovitch (CC BY 2.0) - https://flic.kr/p/paxzB9
